instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> FAN SPINS BUT DOESN´T STOP TO POST
threads.message:
Hi, I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and I have green light, the fan spins, but in this model the fan normally starts for a couple seconds then stops, and start again. It spins but doesn´t stops to make the POST.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.6V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3V

I REMOVED <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> SEEMED TO HAVE CORROSION ON THE BOTTOM, AND WAS PLANNING TO JUMPER TO THE IG CHIP. CAN THIS DO THAT BEHAVIOR?

THANK YOU!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> FAN SPINS BUT DOESN´T STOP TO POST
threads.message:
Reball GMUX and see if something change.
If not, then disable GPU in BIOS.
Do NOT waste time bypassing GMUX; too much work...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> FAN SPINS BUT DOESN´T STOP TO POST
threads.message: Where can I find the reliable steps to disable it via BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> FAN SPINS BUT DOESN´T STOP TO POST
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> FAN SPINS BUT DOESN´T STOP TO POST
threads.message:
I don´t have the medusa, but have a programmer. Where do I get the BIOS?
I reinstalled the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>, now I get a quarter fan spin, and when the spin is about to start spinning <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> goes from 12.60v to 12.30v, does this means it has something to do with the SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> FAN SPINS BUT DOESN´T STOP TO POST
threads.message:
That's no ggod; <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> MUST be stable.

Re-check your job.
What happens that only have quarter fan spin now?
Check for short on any secondary supply GMUX related.

See what happens starting in SMC bypass mode.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
